name: CSP 210
title: Social Sciences for Coastal Sustainability
description: Provides a basic foundation in the social sciences, through systematic study of communities, institutions, and entire societies. Examines the relevance of sociological theory, social interactions and relationships, social inequality, and social change to sustainability issues of the coastal zone.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): concurrent enrollment in CSP 200 and CSP 220. Enrollment is restricted to graduate students in the coastal science and policy program, or by permission of the instructor.
